dialogues.text: It’s a play on words, do you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah I hear it. I just don’t know. (then) What about Mop N’Go. Mop. N'go.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Go where? Where are you gonna go? What does that mean? Here’s the thing. I think Moptastic is something that would stop me in my tracks. It’s dramatic. It’s--it’s MOP-TASTIC.  59.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I like Moptastic, I just wanna explore other options too, you know, that’s our first idea. Is there anything else?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What about Mop Thunder. It’s the power behind it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: The Wringer.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Mop Til You Drop.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: The Mopper.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I’m still leaning towards Moptastic. I don’t see how you couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Mop...tastic. I keep coming back to that.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I just want it to feel a little more personal, you know. It’s--I made it myself.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s like you gave birth. Except it was a mop. A LIGHT-BULB goes off in Joy’s head. She looks at Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What did I say? INT. SAME. MOMENTS LATER. A SINGLE SHEET OF PAPER comes out of the PRINTER. It read THE ORIGINAL MIRACLE MOP! Underneath it reads “Keeps your hands dry” “featuring self-wringing action.” “$19.95 Valu Joy and Ronnie share an approving look. INT. CHURCH HALL. JOB FAIR. Joy talks to Father Benedetti.  60. INT. RUDY’S SHOP. DAY. BOXES of MOP PARTS are opened and half-opened, everything in DISARRAY. Ronnie is on the phone at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Okay. Outside, there is a GUN-SHOT. Ronnie jumps. In the garage area, Joy assembles mops at a very rapid pa Next to her are Viv and Dante, who chat leisurely as they work VERY SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: VIV
dialogues.text: So, where do you work?

dialogues.speaker: DANTE, (TO VIV)
dialogues.text: At Allstate Insurance. Twenty years! Yep. (proud) And they've been trying to fire me since day one.

dialogues.speaker: VIV
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But I’m sticking it out. They ain’t getting rid of me.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Guys. While you’re talking can you please put some mops together? Joy is worried. This is impossible. They are interrupted arguing outside. Joy rushes outside. EXT. SHOP. CONTINUOUS. They find Ronnie arguing with the goombahs.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What’s goin on? I’m trying to have a professional conversation and I keep gettin’ interrupted by gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Relax. It’s just a little target practice.  61.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What?! What do you need target practice for? What is this, the wild west                         Shootin’ at tin cans?? Jesus--— Viv and Dante come out to see what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: Ronnie, get inside!

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me to get inside. You get inside!

dialogues.speaker: DOMINIC
dialogues.text: Why don’t you both get inside! It’s chaos. Joy tries to quiet them but just adds to it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey everybody take it easy! Guys! Guys! Everyone is yelling. Just then, a BUS pulls in at the end the shop’s driveway, catching everyone’s attention. They turn and look toward the bus. It gets quiet. The door opens. A LITTLE DOMINICAN WOMAN walks off of the bus. Then another. Then a man. They are like the people J saw at the job fair, but many more. Men, women, older one Joy, Ronnie and the men watch as the whole bus unloads. T last person to get off is Father Benedetti. He walks up t Joy.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER BENEDETTI
dialogues.text: They don’t speak English but they're legal and they need jobs. Joy's jaw drops. Ronnie is in shock.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: He appeared like Moses. INT. AUTOBODY SHOP. CONTINUOUS. Rudy has people filling out paperwork/W-2 forms.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What if we made an assembly line? Like in the sweat shops?

dialogues.speaker: VIV
dialogues.text: We’re going to need food.  62.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (smiling, to workers) Wow. Okay. Let me think of the best way to do this. Umm...Why don’t you guys come over here. And you two, over here. (to a woman) Hi! I love your scarf. The woman does not understand. Joy escorts her to a table we begin the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Joy demonstrates to employees how to put together the mo -Joy as part of the assembly line. -Joy at Eastern Airlines, listening to a supervisor’s lecture, nodding her head, trying to be present. -Joy rushes into the autobody shop in her Eastern Airline uniform, with ALL THREE KIDS, carrying a bunch of PIZZAS. The employees smile. -Joy and kids in assembly line (kids helping in a fun way -Joy rushes into the diner late, rubbing bleeding callous her hands. -Different CROSS-FADES of Joy getting in and out of her c with and without kids, in different uniforms, always with hands full, and with her head hitting the pillow exhauste in different work uniforms. -Joy takies her temperature and coughing. -Joy enters auto shop in her Eastern Airlines uniform, si and carrying three HUGE 6 foot SUB-SANDWICHES in with her kids in tow. Ronnie concerned. -Joy works on mops alone in the empty shop as clock reads 12:00 pm. Falling asleep on the table. -Joy works at the busy diner. -Joy listens to angry customer at Eastern Airlines. -Joy nervously puts a BIG stack of bills aside. -Joy and Ronnie open a box, revealing a HUGE CAKE that sa “7000 MOPS!” Everybody cheers!! -The clock reads 12:00 am as Joy and Ronnie and the worke help finish loading 7,000 mops into the HSN truck.  63. -Joy and Ronnie stand and watch as the TRUCK DRIVES OFF D THE DRIVEWAY. -Joy loads sleeping kids into car at Toots’s. She’s exhausted. -Joy'’s head hits the pillow. INT. JOY’S HOUSE. Joy takes a lasagna out of the oven while Toots watches h Ronnie and Dante enter with their kids.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE RONNIE
dialogues.text: Hey! Who’s hungry? Ronnie puts a dish of food on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hi! Guys, the kids are outside. Kids run out into the yard.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Can you check the bread? Just crack the oven.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: So, big day for the mops today, huh? What time do they put the segment up?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t make her nervous! Go watch a ball-game.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: Good seeing you Joy. RUDY enters with his girlfriend, Viv. Viv is wearing a HU FUR COAT. It’s awkward.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Hello! We have arrived.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Hey Rudy./Viv.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Uh, Viv, can I take your coat?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Be careful with it. It’s real mink.  64. Joy takes Viv’s coat. Underneath, she’s wearing a shirt w HUGE puffy sleeves. There is a piece of crumpled paper stuffing that peaks out from under one of the sleeves. As quickly tucks it back in, it makes a crinkling sound. The RUDY (CONT’D) (re:Viv) This one. She only wears the best.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!! Okay, deep breath, deep breaths. Rudy has to pass by Toots to get to Joy.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Toots. Toots turns her head away dramatically and doesn’t say anything. Ronnie breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you all go out into the living room and give us some room, here. Too many cooks.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: (being dramatic) Joy. I’m gonna go upstairs. Joy rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Mom. You're gonna hang out upstairs by yourself?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Toots go ahead. I’1l come get you when it starts. INT. JOY'S LIVING ROOM. A LITTLE LATER. The TV is on HSN. Two hosts stand behind a table with decorative bowls on it, in the middle of a sales pitch. They are ALL, kids included, gathered around the televisi talking excitedly. Joy is laughing but extremely nervous.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: Wait a second these guys sold 36,000 potpourri holders!? Get the hell out of here-

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Dante, with the chatter! Stop your lips from moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you bustin’ my chops? 65. The TV cuts to a MALE HOST standing on a SET that is buil look like a GARAGE. He’s holding JOY’S MOP.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Quiet everybody. This is us! Joy holds Christie close.

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m Mike Gable and this is our special Deal of the Day.

dialogues.speaker: JOY/RONNIE
dialogues.text: Ahhh! / SHHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST
dialogues.text: And fellas, this one is for us. Joy looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How many times have you been in the garage, you know, up to your elbows in the grease and grime. You’re changing the oil, building a deck, doing household projects, and all of sudden things get real messy. You've got anti-freeze, mud, or some sort of dirty fluid all over the garage. Now what!?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What the hell is this guy talking about??

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST
dialogues.text: You need to mop. And I hate mopping. Everybody hates mopping. Mopping is boring, am I right? Well here’s the thing: if you HAVE TO mop, this is your guy right here. The Miracle Mop. The HOST puts the mop in a bucket of DIRTY WATER, making mop dirty and then applies the dirty water to the floor. starts to get flustered.

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All you do is push, sorry, you pull this part here and you twist it.... The HOST has no idea how to use the mop. He vamps.  66.

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then see how this part wrings the water out.. Okay, now the thing about this thing is that this part comes on and off. He searches for the switch near the mop head.

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a lever under here that you just pull and this mop head pops right off. Or is it a button. Something’s tangled. I know this is supposed to be a button, does this eject? Haha. Oh! Here we go. He’s lost.

dialogues.speaker: MALE HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at the way this works in the water. A real miracle. Folks, we've only got a few of these left and a couple more minutes... The screen reads 12 sold. The room is quiet. No one knows what to say. Joy is stunn After a beat she gets up abruptly and TURNS OFF the TV.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Joy-- Before Ronnie can say anything, Joy is ON HER WAY into th kitchen and dialing the phone. Everybody just watches her

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hi. Valerie please. This is Joy Mangano. Ok will you please tell her to call me as soon as she gets a chance? It’s urgent. JOY'S KITCHEN. A LITTLE LATER. Ronnie stands with Joy. . . JOY . Hi, its Joy Mangano again. JOY'S KITCHEN. LATER. People are cleaning up, gathering their stuff.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I just hadn’t heard from her yet.  JOY'S HOUSE. LATER. Everybody files out, leaving.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Not good. Not good.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: Joy. You tried. It was the best you could do. The Martorella women are cursed. It’s in our blood. Joy is somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?? Joy. You okay? INT. JOY’S KITCHEN. MORNING. Joy on phone again. Kids in background.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay I will hold until she’s ready. I can wait as long as it takes. 67. She is surprised when Valerie promptly comes on the line.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mangano.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Valerie. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: VALERIE
dialogues.text: Sometimes items we put up just don’t hit with the viewers. Unfortunately your mop was one of those cases. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: But the mop was marketed completely wrong. It was sold as a shop mop. Everything was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Joy. We’ll send the load back to you. You can expect it by end of next week at the latest.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait. Don’t send any loads back yet. Cause I need to show you how to do it. If you give it another shot, the right way, people will buy it.  INT. HSN. 68.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIE
dialogues.text: It’s not my decision. The sales determine the fate of the product and this product, as you could see, did not perform well.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: But it’s because of the demo. The demo was done wrong.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Like I said I don’t make these decisions.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Who's decision was it then? RECEPTION AREA. A RECEPTIONIST sits at the front. (WHERE IS HSN and how d Joy get there?) Joy enters holding her mop and bucket. Sh speaks very politely.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Doug Briggs.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m here to see Doug Briggs. My name is Joy Mangano.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Okay. (looking at appointment list, confused) Do you...have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No. I just need to speak with him briefly.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Oh. Well. Mr. Briggs is ina meeting right now.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Perfect. Where is he at? The receptionist is surprised. Joy is not being deterred.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Ma’ am--  69.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You know what? I’1l just find him. Joy smiles, breezes past the receptionist and down the ha

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Ma’ am--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m not dangerous. I’1ll just be a minute. Not gonna hurt anyone. The receptionist pushes a button on her switchboard.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Mark. Mark? The receptionist doesn’t know what to do. Joy goes down t first hallway and starts looking at the different doors w the people’s names and their titles. A few employees walk right by her. They’re too busy to notice her. She doesn’t Doug’s name. As she turns around changing directions, she bumps into the JANITOR, an older man.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh! I’m so sorry. Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Haha! You are going fast.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I am. I’m sorry. I’m looking for Doug Briggs. I’m supposed to have a meeting with him right now. Do you know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: He’s in 2B. You gotta take the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thank you. INT. UPSTAIRS HSN HALLWAY. Joy finds 2B. She knocks.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM INSIDE
dialogues.text: Yeah it’s open. Joy enters the room without hesitation. There’s a LONG TA 15 men. A BOARD MEETING. Joy is caught off guard. One of men, WALT, speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Can I help you?  70. She quickly recovers, shuts the door behind her and addre the room.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yes. I’m here to see Doug Briggs. All of the men look over to ONE OF THE MEN. It’s clearly BRIGGS. He addresses Joy.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: And who are you?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m Joy Mangano. You botched my demo.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: I what?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You botched my demo.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Does anyone know what this woman's talking about?

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Last night, Joy’s mop sold twelve units in the H.I. slot.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Oh. Miss Mangano, I see this all the time. You have a brand new product, and you think everyone is gonna buy it. Sometimes reality doesn’t match our dreams.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question. Would you use a toaster to open a can? Would you use a fork to paint a wall? No you wouldn't. That joker you had out there last night was trying to sell my household mop as a garage tool to men. People aren’t gonna buy something if they don’t know what it’s for.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: We did the demo the way we saw fit. Another man leans to the guy next to him.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) It’s always the demo, huh? Never the product.  71. Joy barrels forward.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: There’s nothing wrong with this product. This product--my FIVE year old could use it. That’s the whole reason I made it. This mop is SIMPLE.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Okay Joy well thanks a lot for that, we are gonna get back to work-

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (to Doug) Do you pee standing up?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Do you pee standing up?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Uhh...Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Have you ever mopped around the toilet? (turns to the table) When was the last time any of you mopped your bathroom floor? (nothing) Well, let me tell you how it works. The floor is covered in urine. It collects in a big halo around the toilet. And there’s other stuff on the floor too. Its disgusting. So your wife mops it up. She dunks her mop in the urine-water, takes the same mop into the kitchen and mops that floor, where your babies crawl on their hands and knees and drop their pacifier, and then they stick that pacifier back in their mouths. While this is happening, your wife is trying to wring the thing out, chapping her hands, breaking her back and eventually getting down on her hands and knees to finish the job that the mop can’t do. She spends most of her day this way, getting up and down on and off of the floor. And then you come home, after your busy day at the office, and your long commute home, and you wonder why you don’t get laid.  72. The men are all quiet.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Alright. Well, thank you Miss Mangano, we're right in the middle of--

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Hang on. (thinks ) Jerry do we have time on Wednesday for Joy?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It depends on what we decide to do with the grout demo.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Grout? How many times a year do you use grout? Doug shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: If we keep grout on Wednesday there’s a Thursday promo slot.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: What about today? Joy lights up.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Today the only flexibility we have is cosmetics. Right before the Rugs and Lighting Extravaganza. Doug thinks. He looks at Joy.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Ok Miss Mangano. You think you can run my network? You’re going on the air in 20 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: You. I did it my way. Now it’s your turn. That way we won’t have to have this meeting again. On Joy’s horrified look.  73. INT. RONNIE’S HOUSE. Joy and Ronnie’s kids play in the background. We intercut with Ronnie and Joy, who is on a business phone in the GR ROOM at HSN.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes??

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m in some room, there are people, I don’t know what is happening. Something came over me Ronnie, I couldn’t stop myself.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Okay. We’re going to Vito’s soccer party and I’1l turn it on at the restaurant. You alright?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. No. I don’t know. Joy hangs up. She’s facing a MIRROR. A friendly man, GEOR does her make-up. He chats away happily to her, but all s hears is the CONVERSATION of the WOMEN BEHIND HER.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Do we have wardrobe for her?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: No I just found out two seconds ago.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Let me see if I have something. A man walks up.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I gotta take her George. Joy. We're gonna have you walk now.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What? Well that’s gonna have to do. George takes her smock off. Joy follows the walk across t room, passing other HOSTS--BEAUTIFUL, perfectly groomed models, who sit on their break, chatting. Joy takes it in  74.

dialogues.speaker: MODEL
dialogues.text: Good luck! /Break a leg/ Who is that? INT. HALLWAY. CONTINUOUS. They walk down the long hallway. The man with her talks i his headset.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Copy. I’ve got Joy. We’re heading to set. About thirty seconds. People move and run around her very quickly. Joy is intimidated by the fast-paced atmosphere. A WARDROBE PERS cwalks up. Another WOMAN WITH PAPERS runs up to her.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN WITH PAPERS
dialogues.text: Joy we're gonna need you to sign this release.

dialogues.speaker: WARDROBE
dialogues.text: I’ve got pants for her.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: She doesn’t have time. INT. SET. CONTINUOUS. They come around a corner onto a huge soundstage. The set made up to look like a country kitchen. There is a lot of action around her. People are darting past, hurried and hectic.

dialogues.speaker: SEGMENT PRODUCER
dialogues.text: Oh! Great. Okay. I’m gonna need you to stand right here. A HAIR PERSON comes up and sprays a bunch of aerosol hairspray. Joy breathes a bunch of it in.

dialogues.speaker: SEGMENT PRODUCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy this is your mark. Okay. Don’t go outside the blue tape, but don’t look down at the blue tape. Just know that you can’t go outside of it. A SOUND GUY walks up and puts a mic cable up her skirt. H eyes go big. The sound guy signals to her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND GUY
dialogues.text: Your blouse. Can you grab it?  75. She reaches in and finds the mic, clumsily pulls it out. she gets mic’d, two p.a’s Are talking. P.A. Do we have a mop? Where’s the mop?

dialogues.speaker: P.A.
dialogues.text: What? P.A. The thing she’s selling. A SEGMENT PRODUCER walks up with another HOST and hands J the MOP.

dialogues.speaker: SEGMENT PRODUCER
dialogues.text: Here, ya go, honey. This is Chrystal. She’s gonna host with you today. She’s basically just here to cue you and you go ahead and let’her rip.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ok. Joy looks up at Chrystal--a TALL, LONG-LEGGED, FLAWLESS LOOKING BLONDE. Joy has never seen a woman like this up close.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Hi! Well, are you ready? Joy smooths her pants. She nods unsure. As Chrystal gets mic’d, Joy mumbles to herself.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Fuck. Fucking...Doug Briggs. She hears a voice in her earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (0.S. IN EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS. Doug sits in front of a huge MONITOR that shows what home audiences are seeing. As they prep Joy, the monitor shows women on another soundstage selling designer eyewear.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: It’s Doug. You ready?  INT. HSN. 76.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? Yes. (then) Did you hear me say fucking Doug Briggs?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: We all did. Joy, 15 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay. CONTINUOUS . Joy stands ALONE in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCER
dialogues.text: We're going in 10, 9, 8-- All of a sudden, it goes DEAD QUIET. The BRIGHT STUDIO LI COME ON. Joy squints but can make out the hand of the cam man signaling them to go.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Well good evening here on HSN I’m your host Chrystal Gaines and we are gonna end this Thursday with our incredible Deal of the Day. If you've ever been frustrated with mopping, I can absolutely relate, and boy do we have the perfect product for you. It is called the Miracle Mop--It'’s the first ever self-wringing mop. So easy to use. And here to tell us more about it, the woman who created it, Joy Mangano. Joy, I can’t wait to hear about this mop. How does it work? Joy is completely frozen. WE NOW ECHO THE VERY FIRST SHOT THE MOVIE WHERE WE CAME IN ON JOY. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (V.O. IN EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: Okay Joy that’s you.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (V.O. IN EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through earpiece) Joy, go ahead. Joy.  77. INT. CONTROL ROOM. Doug checks the monitor. On the bottom, there is a RED LI that indicates the VOLUME OF CALLS coming in for the eyew In BLACK LETTERS on the screen it reads the NUMBER SOLD. on a smaller monitor that reads NUMBER OF CALLERS WAITING The RED LINE on Doug’s monitor is DIVING. Joy is paralyze

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: (through earpiece) We gotta get her outta there. INT. PIZZA PLACE. CONTINUOUS. Joy and Chrystal on the TV, as Ronnie, Dante and all of t kids watch Joy and Chrystal on the tv, on pins and needle

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: She's got the stage fright. That’s it. It’s over.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Dante! Come on, Joy. INT. HSN. CONTINUOUS. Chrystal, not sure what’s wrong with Joy, keeps talking l a pro.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Like so many of us, you must have been so tired of getting your hands down in that dirty water, chapping your hands and breaking your back to wring it out. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's right. That’s...what happens.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Unbelievable! And now, I’m told you designed this mop yourself. And you assembled this. This is not some factory-made item, this is a hand- loomed, hand-made mop.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I-I made...the mop. Joy looks like her head’s going to explode.  78. INT. PIZZA PLACE. CONTINUOUS. They watch as Chrystal covers for Joy.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Next time you’re looking 35 to 40 dollars for this mop. I’m so excited to be a part of this. This is so exciting. Isn't it, Joy? Joy nods, frozen in fear.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Ronnie grabs a NAPKIN, looks at the tv, and scribbles something on the napkin. She runs to the pizza cook.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Richie let me use the phone. I need the phone!

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I’m takin’ an order. Come on, I already let you use the tv! He turns his back on her.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Aww, come on! Ronnie thinks fast, swipes her purse off the counter and flying out the door.

dialogues.speaker: DANTE
dialogues.text: Where you goin?! EXT. PIZZA PLACE. CONTINUOUS. Ronnie runs outside in the POURING RAIN, searches frantically. She sees something and RUNS ACROSS the stree the rain, reaching into her purse. INT. HSN. Joy is now demo’ing the mop.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Um, you just the handle up and then you pull

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy turns her back to the camera. Not a flattering angle.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (V.O. IN EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: Joy turn around.  79. Joy turns around.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. And then you pull the handle right here, and you twist, and that way you don’t have to bend down and do it. And then, um, you-- you pull and you twist, scuse me.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (V.O. IN EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: Stop saying excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (V.O. IN EARPIECE)
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me, do the mop.

dialogues.speaker: P.A., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Get in the blue tape! Joy realizes she’s out of the blue tape, steps back. She completely disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: So, it basically....... wrings? Joy looks like she’s given up/burst into tears.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Exactly! No more water all over the floor. You fall and you slip a disc--this is happening to people every day all over the country. (then, very relieved) It looks like we have a caller. We are talking to Lynette in Queens. Hi Lynette! How are you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: LYNETTE
dialogues.text: Hi Chrystal! I love this mop! EXT. STREET. CONTINUOUS. It’s Ronnie. She’s standing in the pouring rain at a PAYP across the street from the pizza place. We INTERCUT betwe Ronnie on the payphone and Joy and Chrystal at HSN.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I just bought one. Listen, I have a story for Joy I just had to share.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: We'd love to hear!  80.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Well, my son is very mischievous. He loves flushing things down the toilet. Joy looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: You're kidding. Joy clues in a little, curious.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: So the other day, I hear the toilet flush and I wake up and my radar goes off, so I think--oh no, what has he put down there now? So I step out of my bed and my feet sink into four inches of water and literally flooded my entire upstairs. I spend the whole day cleaning and my husband gets in there and pulls out my favorite pair of HOT PINK STRETCH pants. Joy, KNOWING this is Ronnie, nods. She’s instantly calm a relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You're kidding. How did he get a pair of pants in there?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, you know how boys are. Ronnie is getting SOAKED, but continues to play with Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: How old is your son?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: He's FIVE.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (humoring Ronnie, playful) I have a five year old too and let me tell you, the things they get into. INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS. The NUMBER SOLD starts climbing. 5...

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: Here we go.  81. Doug looks at the screen and the RED LINE starts to RISE. INT. HSN STUDIO. Joy is starting to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Anyway after sopping up basically water from the toilet all day, I got so excited about this WASHABLE MOP-HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Right. Lynette, you know what’s great about the mop-head?

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I'm dying to know.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We give you two of them. So while you're washing the one you just dirtied, you always have a back-up one to switch it out with.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I love that! That’s why I am gonna buy one for each of my sisters.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Oh, you have sisters.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I have four sisters... INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROLLER
dialogues.text: Look at this. Doug looks at the monitor. 500 callers waiting. 325 sold. INT. STUDIO. CONTINUOUS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, Lynette. And we actually have some callers waiting now, sO we’re gonna have to let somebody else in.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you and I LOVE THIS MOP!  82.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Lynette! EXT. STREET. CONTINUOUS. Ronnie hangs up, hopeful. She looks around, soaking wet. heads back across the street. INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS. Doug cannot believe his eyes. The line climbs dramaticall up. The screen reads 600 sold. INT. STUDIO. CONTINUOUS. Joy talks with another customer.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER, (V.O)
dialogues.text: My mother is always so critical of my house.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, tell me about it. Does yours check the corners? Mine likes to comment on how dirty the corners are in my kitchen and then watches HSN while I clean. INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS. Doug is amused. The numbers rapidly climb. 1700 SOLD. 900 callers on hold. 5 minutes left. INT. STUDIO. CONTINUOUS. Joy is laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well technically cleaning is a form of exercise, don’t be so hard on yourself! INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS. 3700 MOPS. 3 minutes to go. 1000 callers on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: It has made my life easier and I believe whole-heartedly that it will make yours easier too, Carol!  83. INT. CONTROL ROOM. CONTINUOUS. 6200 mops. 1 minute to go. Doug and the others watch as the numbers climb to 7000 mo INT. PIZZA PLACE. CONTINUOUS. Ronnie walks in, breathing heavily and soaked. Dante look her dumbfounded. INT. STUDIO. CONTINUOUS.

dialogues.speaker: HOST
dialogues.text: And it looks like we’ve run out of mops. But don’t let stop you from calling. You can put one on back- order and we'll have it to you A.S.A.P. Don’t’ hang up that phone. Joy, thank you. It has been an honor to be a part of your HSN debut. Joy is so relieved, now very much herself.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thank you. I’m so glad we got through that first part, I was so nervous, I almost peed my pants. Chrystal looks at Joy.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: Haha alright. Well we’re gonna go to Shannon, who’s standing by with a grout shield that’s gonna blow your mind. The segment producer signals to Chrystal and Joy that the done. A sigh of relief is heard throughout the room. Chrystal looks at Joy as she takes her mic off. CHRYSTAL (CONT’D) Great job, Joy. Way to pull it out.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Chrystal smiles and heads out. The PA comes to help Joy t off her mic. Joy’s hands shake. She is in shock. Doug approaches.  84.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Well. I think at this point me telling you that you were right is a little anti-climactic. Joy smiles. DOUG BRIGGS (CONT’D) People really connected with you out there. You okay? You seem a little out of it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah I--I’m happy that I’m gonna keep my house. INT. RONNIE’S HOUSE. NEXT DAY. Ronnie, Dante, their kids and Joy’s kids are finishing dinner. Everybody cheers. The kids run to her.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Yay! !/Mommy ! Joy is happy. She looks at Ronnie.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hi, Lynette.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I panicked. EXT. MAILBOX. JOY’S HOUSE. Joy opens the mailbox, sifts through a stack of bills. Sh opens an envelope. She pulls out a NOTE: “Congratulations Sincerely, ‘Fucking Doug Briggs’.” Behind the note is a CHECK. Joy’s face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -The mailbox opens again. A hand puts a STACK of BILLS in and puts the flag up. Pull back on Joy, very satisfied. -At HSN, Joy in business meeting with Doug. He trains her -Joy throws away her Eastern airlines uniform. -Joy runs water in the bathtub. It’s fixed! Kids jump in. -Joy, with Jackie in her arms, pulls a garage door to rev a WAREHOUSE SPACE. Ronnie stands with her. Ronnie walks i They both smile. The kids run into the warehouse, excited  85. -HSN. Joy, now slightly more confident than the first tim saw her, stands with Chrystal. Chrystal throws it to Joy. This time, Joy does not hesitate. -Mets game. Joy, with kids, cheering on a home run. -HSN. Joy in the middle of a segment with a caller. She’s the groove. -HSN. GREEN ROOM. Joy walks out of HSN with the MODEL HOS all putting their coats on. She looks as polished as them -JOY'S WAREHOUSE. The beginnings of a business. The warehouse, although nothing glamorous, bustles with activity. There is a small assembly line. The same Domini people who helped assemble mops before now they wear ligh blue polo shirts like the ones Ronnie and Joy wore at KMA There is shipping area where boxes are brought in. Ronnie sits at a desk on the phone, yelling at someone. Joy sits a desk with a little GRAPEVINE WREATH behind her on the w She stands up, stretches, and looks around, happy. INT. JOY'S HOUSE. DAY. Joy leads the kids BLIND-FOLDED out of the kitchen throug the sliding glass door to the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay. Take’em off. The kids take their blindfolds off and their faces LIGHT REVEAL an ABOVE-GROUND SWIMMING POOL FULL OF WATER and re for use. Inside of it are inflatable POOL TOYS, and Joy h set up MINI BEACH CHAIRS for them. It’s blue-collar fancy

dialogues.speaker: AHHHHHH
dialogues.text: EXT. JOY’S BACKYARD. LATER THAT AFTERNOON. Joy and Ronnie’s kids play in the pool, having the time o their lives. Joy has a table set up with balloons, etc. R Viv, Ronnie, Dante, watch the kids swim. Toots is in Joy’ ear.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: I just gotta get out of that place. It’s too small. It’s like living in a mouse house, Joy. We gotta get me out of there.  86.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Mom, can we talk about this later? I got a lot going on right now, I can’t talk about it now.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: You can’t? Or you won’t? Cause there’s a big difference.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: I see. I don’t ask for much. But you have some success and there you go and leave us all behind.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE
dialogues.text: Mommy, come in the pool! A buzzer goes off inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, guys, I can’t! I gotta put the chicken in. Joy goes into the house. INT. KITCHEN. CONTINUOUS. Joy enters and is met by TONY, who has rounded the corner looks dapper, wearing summer clothes and holds a big birt gift.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey. Joy is in a good mood. He looks outside at the pool.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s Michelle?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: No. We’re not. Anymore. (looks out to pool) Wow. There it is, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yep. They’ve been having so much fun they're turning to prunes but I don’t have the heart to take them out.  87. Tony turns from the pool to look at Joy, intensely.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: How ya doin?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Good. He studies her for a second, smiles that winning smile.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You look different.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I do?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You look good. Joy reacts. Tony back-peddles.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean not like you didn’t look good before but--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah yeah yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (sincere) I’m serious. I’m trying to compliment you.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (playful) Go play with your kids. Tony walks past Joy. She shakes the moment off and watche he goes outside.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE AND BOBBY
dialogues.text: Daddy!!!/Daddy are you gonna swim?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? That’s what I came for. Hi Christie.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE
dialogues.text: (unenthusiastic) Hi. Tony takes off his shirt, down to his swim trunks, and cannonballs into the pool, making a huge splash. This win Christie over and kids all erupt with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Daddy!/Hi Daddy/Daddy watch me!  88. Joy watches them from the kitchen. Looks like old times. EXT. BACKYARD. MOMENTS LATER. Joy and Ronnie bring food out. Tony is in the water with kids still. Tony has one of those big WATER GUNS that sho a HUGE stream of water.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Wait, was it you? Or you? Or...all of you! Tony squirts them all and they scream with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You know who I think needs to get wet? He looks over at Toots.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: Tony, no!! Tony squirts a tiny squirt in Toots’ direction, teasing h

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tony! ! (laughs ) I can never be mad at you. (then) It’s such a shame.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Get me again daddy!/Squirt me!!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know what I think? I think maybe we need to get your mom into her bikini, get her into the pool. Joy's head whips around.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Nobody wants that, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: That's what you think. Joy looks at Tony like WTF??

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Don’t hold your breath, Tony. Tony squirts Ronnie.  89.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tony, I swear to God, don’t you dare. Tony turns to Joy, squirts a little squirt in her directi

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Don’t. Again.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop it. Tony starts squirting Joy a little by little and she’s running from it. He fills up the gun. He stares at her, threatening.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t squirt me. Tony UNLOADS. Joy screams, ducks, and the stream from Ton gun NAILS VIV in the back of the head, who happens to be behind Joy and looking the other way. It BLOWS a HAIRPIEC off of the top of her head, revealing a bald spot.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: VIV
dialogues.text: Whoop! Viv quickly fixes it. Everybody BUSTS out laughing. Joy i HYSTERICS.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Vivi!!! I’m sorry! Viv, I’m so sorry, I didn’t know you were behind me. Oh my god. Oh my God. Viv laughs, good-naturedly. EXT. JOY’S HOUSE. LATER. They all walk out, happily. Joy notices a BRAND NEW, WHIT CADILLAC CONVERTIBLE with a WHITE TOP is parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wow. New car, huh?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. This thing is slick. I took Viv to the Dinner Theater the other night and the valet couldn’t stop talking about it. He sees cars all day. He parked it right up front.  90.

dialogues.speaker: VIV
dialogues.text: I told Rudy everyone should own a convertible once in their life. Joy and Tony share a look. They are connecting. Rudy and walk off.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Great dad.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Well, I better get going too. Come here. Tony squats down to hug the kids. They are tired.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Daddy, don’t go away.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I have to go. I gotta go sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: When are you gonna come back?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: I'll see you in two weeks. Okay? Two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you guys go brush your teeth, it’s way past your bedtime. They turn and go.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Thanks that was a fun time.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yeah, it was.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Boy, that pool. The kids went crazy for it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tony looks at her as if he’s going to say something. Joy wants to say something but doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drive safe.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Yeah.  INT. HSN OFFICES. EVENING. A PARTY. People eat pizza, drink out of plastic cups. A banner reads “Congratulations Joy! Best New Product!” Joy sits drinking out of a plastic cup. Doug finishes a speec

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: And I just want to say it’s been a fantastic ride this last quarter, thanks to Joy and her ...what’s the name of that mop again? People laugh. Joy looks at him “very funny.” DOUG BRIGGS (CONT’D) Seriously. This thing has really been picking up momentum. For those of us who have worked closely with Joy, there is no doubt that we've only scratched the surface with what this woman is capable of. And so, it is my pleasure to announce that as of next week, we will be moving the mop to Prime Time. Joy's face lights up. Everybody claps for her.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thank you! People resume socializing. Joy takes in the scene. She fe proud. Doug comes over.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: You know you get to take that banner home with you. You got a spot for that?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (playful, smiles) No. I was thinking of you taking it. So you remember how you almost made a really, really big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: I’m still hearing about that, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sorry. INT. SAME. A LITTLE LATER. Less crowd noise, less people. Joy and Doug talk.  92.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I’ve always kind of done stuff like this. When I was a kid this one summer I built a tree house.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, so did I , me and my brother. We had an observation deck.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Mine was seven stories.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. It had a pulley system so you could put something in a box and move it from one level in and out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Geez. Wow. How old were you?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I think I was 9.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: (laughing) Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah then I worked at a vet when I was fourteen, and these animals used to come in from getting hit by cars out on the highway, so I made this glow in the dark dog collar.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: (amused) Really.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah I actually sent it to Hartz, and they never got back to me.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Wait, didn’t they--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. They came out with the same one like a year later. And then I made this one-man-band thing, where I duct-taped a bunch of instruments together-- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy nods. 93.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (stopping herself) I know, I’m weird.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Yeah, you’re a weirdo.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey. All that stuff is what got me into college.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: What school?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (regrets she said that) Uh...Harvard.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Harvard!?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. No, I didn’t go. I got in. I was gonna go. But, my parents divorced at that time, so I stayed home. My Mom needed me there. She was really distraught.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: So you stayed home from Harvard.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Harvard.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah you can stop rubbing it in now. Doug is flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Sorry it’s just--Wow. I could never do that.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I didn’t really have a choice. It’s okay. A year later I enrolled in Pace University so I did go to school eventually. College.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: No. I mean I could never ask my kid to do that. I’d never forgive myself. Joy absorbs this.  94. DOUG BRIGGS (CONT’D) You know where we should send that banner? Send it to Hartz. Those bastards stole your idea. INT. JOY’S BASEMENT. LATER. On Joy’s hand, hammering. Turn around on her, looking around at her old work statio The area is a mess. Among the clutter is remnants from th wreaths. She starts to clean up. She steps back and admir the BANNER from HSN, hung above her old work station. INT. HSN. STAGE. Joy and Chrystal are doing their thing.

dialogues.speaker: CHRYSTAL
dialogues.text: And that concludes our time with Joy and her amazing Miracle Mop! We have broken the sales record for the segment at 40,000 mops! Folks we have just witnessed HSN history.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (on top of the world!) Unbelievable! Now if you haven’t gotten through yet, don’t worry, we're gonna keep the after hours lines open and you all know how that works. Just give us a call and you can place your order. Thank you so much! Good night! INT. HSN. STAGE. HALLWAY. Joy walks off stage. Doug approaches Joy, over the moon.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: Joy! Wow.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry! I knew we were over- selling, but I didn’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG BRIGGS
dialogues.text: There is nothing to apologize about here. You broke a record. Don’t worry. But we had 10,000 ready in the wings, so you’ve got two weeks to get us the other 30,000.  95.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No problem. We’1ll get on it. Joy smiles, confidently. Doug smiles and walks off. INT. RUDY’S AUTOBODY SHOP. Joy sits across from Rudy at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Avalon wants to go up to six dollars per mop.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: They feel that now that the volume’s increased, they wanna up their price.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That doesn’t make sense. The cost per mop should be less with a bigger order.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: That’s not the way they’re doing it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? They can’t. We can’t do that. I can’t make a profit that way. I’m out of business that way. I can’t afford to sell them. At that price, I lose money on every mop I sell.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Well, you’re gonna have to cut back somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Cut back? There’s nowhere to cut. We need to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I did. These guys are not gonna budge on this. This is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well they can’t do that. This isn’t right.  96.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: This is business. Believe me. I know how this works. This is how this works, Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well then I wanna talk to them. Where’s the contract?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Contract? There’s no contract. Joy freezes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. We don’t have a contract with these people??

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I told ‘em what we needed. They made it. Now they wanna change the price.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That’s why you need a contract.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Joy. I’ve worked with these guys a long time. They run a good business, but you know they got expenses too.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What?! Their expenses? What about us? What about our business? I have two weeks to produce 30,000 mops. They're putting this whole thing in jeopardy. We have to take the molds somewhere else. We’ll get bids.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Sweetheart. You’re talking to a 30 year entrepreneur on this. It’s not that easy. And you don’t wanna get caught up bickering over six bucks when you got a big order hangin’ over your head. Let’s just get the mops made. We’1ll worry about it on the next order. INT. JOY'S HOUSE. LIVING ROOM. Joy sits with Ronnie. Kids play in background.  97.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe he wouldn’t get anything in writing.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. At this point maybe we need to ask ourselves if he really knows what he’s doing. I mean, it’s his generation. For cryin’ out loud, look at our families. They used to trade carpet cleaning for a salami at the deli and then trade that for a set of white walls. I don’t mean any disrespect but, you’ve come this far. And now you can’t move forward because he...he blew it. Joy thinks about this.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I just wanna talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: We have to try to figure this out the best we can. And for now, we should keep him out of the loop, cause he’s not helping. Joy knows this is true. INT. JOY'S OFFICE. CONTINUOUS. Joy is on the phone. A voice-mail. Beep.

dialogues.speaker: VOICEMAIL
dialogues.text: Avalon Industries.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hi I’m looking for Evan Reynolds, my name is Joy-- The machine hangs up on her. She tries again. The same thing happens.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Joy hangs up, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: Same again. Again. Again.  98. INT. LAW OFFICE. A modest but professional law office. Joy sits in front o lawyer. JOHN CALCAGNY. A HOT-SHOT in his 40s.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: You're doing the right thing. It’s absolutely necessary to get everything in writing. I’1ll draft you up a contract with the terms of the agreement, and date that you need them delivered by. Once he signs it, the deal is formalized.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Right. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: But you have to get that signature. EXT. RONNIE’S HOUSE. Ronnie opens the door to reveal Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m going to California.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: To Avalon?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Do they know you're comin?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: What if they don’t budge on the price?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I get my molds back and take’em somewhere else. Ronnie looks at Joy through the smoke of her Virginia Sli  99.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: I want to meet Steve Garvey. EXT. APARTMENT. Joy stands there with the kids and their sleeping bags.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You sure this is okay? I know it’s not your weekend.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: It’s no problem. Come on guys! Who wants to play Atari?

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Yay! Daddy! INT. LAX. Plane lands. Welcome to Los Angeles! INT. HAWTHORNE CALIFORNIA. INDUSTRIAL COMPLEX. DAY. Joy and Ronnie drive a rental car. All of the buildings l the same, offices with attached warehouses. Ronnie pulls into a parking spot. Joy and Ronnie get out the car and enter through a door with the address number above it. INT. OFFICE. CONTINUOUS. Joy and Ronnie enter. Two YOUNG 30-ish men, in shorts and sandals behind a COUNTER, look at paperwork. They are drinking SHASTA. One, JACK, holds a CLIPBOARD. The other is Victor. Joy and Ronnie put on their best business attitudes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yes, hi. I’m looking for Evan Reynolds.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Uh, Evan’s not here.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh. When will he be back?  100.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No way to know. He’s on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay. I need to get in touch with him. My name is Joy Mangano and he makes parts for my mops. Victor EXITS as if to not even paying attention to her.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You might know my father, Rudy. He’s been handling the business end of things up until now, but I have some business with Evan that I need to resolve immediately. Is there a number where I can contact him?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, like I said, he’s on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ok. Can we call him?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have a phone where he is.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ok. Do you have a manager that’s here? Somebody in charge while he’s gone?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Unfortunately. Evan’s the only one in charge. Everyone else is just workers.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (sigh) So then no one can help me? To retain the business I’m doing with you? No one can talk to me about this right now, and no one can be reached by phone. There’s nothing that can be done. Is that what I’m getting?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Leave me your number and I’1l have Evan call you at his earliest convenience.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Which means never.  101. Joy looks at Ronnie, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell you what. I’m gonna have a truck here in an hour. Please have the molds for my mops ready to go. I’m gonna have to take’em out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we don’t have any molds here.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What do you mean you don’t have any molds here? You don’t have my molds?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Then why does everything that’s shipped to my warehouse come from this address?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s a misprint.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? How could it be a misprint? Ronnie where’s the shipping slip? Ronnie exits.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you giving me the run- around? This is Avalon Industries?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Evan Reynolds is the CEO of this company.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Then you have my molds.  102. EXT. OFFICE. CONTINUOUS. Ronnie, grabs a folder out of the car. She closes the doo and sees Victor standing in the street directing four oth guys, who are quickly wheeling 6 X 6 steel slabs into the back of a truck. MOLDS!!!! Ronnie DUCKS behind her car.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Holy shit. INT. AVALON OFFICE. CONTINUOUS.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to tell you, lady. I don’t have any molds here. And you're starting to get on my nerves.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I would hate to get on your nerves. I have been sending royalties to a man named Evan Reynolds, who has been available enough to cash those checks, but now, just as he is trying to jack up the price on me, pulls a disappearing act. Now you stand here telling me this. I’11 tell you what. I’m coming back in an hour with a U-haul and somebody better produce my molds. You think I’m on your nerves right now? I haven’t even started. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whoa, that sounds so scary. Joy grabs ONE of the EMPTY SHASTA CANS down on the counte and SLAMS it down, crushing it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I know you’re up to something. And I will find out what it is. She walks out, never breaking her stare from him. He star at her, totally unfazed. He laughs. EXT. OFFICE. Joy exits. She buckles, holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ooh. Ow.  103. Ronnie is crouched behind the car as the truck is pulling away. Joy looks at Ronnie confused.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: They put the molds in the back of that truck.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? Joy sees the truck disappear down the street.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get in. Joy and Ronnie jump in the car. Joy is in the DRIVERS SEA Joy tears out of the parking lot, makes a right onto the stret. She sees the TRUCK cruising about four small block stopping at a stop sign, then making a RIGHT. Joy accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Steady, Joy. When Joy hits the stop sign at the corner, she slowly bre around the corner without fully stopping.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No one’s around. They are now on HAWTHORNE BLVD, a busy street.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh Lord. Lord be with us. They see the truck up ahead in the far right lane.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There he is. Get over! Joy puts her blinker on to get to the right. The car on t right won't let her in. Ronnie yells at the man, waves he hands.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's trying to get over!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Come on! The car will not let her in. They won’t even make eye contact.  104.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you can see me. Really? Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: (to the other driver) Oh that’s just rude!! Yeah I’m talking to YOU. You’re a rude person. I know you can see us. Out of the side of your eye! The truck now makes a RIGHT turn up ahead, passes a GAS STATION. Ronnie calls out to Joy.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s turning!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ahh, gotta go, gotta go, gotta go..

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. This is not healthy. JOY GETS CALM and LASER FOCUSED. She SEES THERE IS SPACE

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD BETWEEN THE CAR IN FRONT OF HER AND THE CAR THAT
dialogues.text: WOULDN'T LET HER IN. She accelerates and drives IN BETWEE the two cars in front of her, RIDING the DOTTED LINE, the cutting IN FRONT OF a low-rider. With more cars in front of her, Joy drives up into the ga station driveway and breezes through the gas station, pas several pumps. A WOMAN comes out of the MINI-MART holding drinks. She se Joy coming and GASPS. Joy skillfully maneuvers her way ar the woman and comes out on the other side and makes her w down onto the street, cutting the corner.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the woman) Sorry! We’re in a chase here! Joy and Ronnie spot the truck up ahead. Joy floors it to catch up, but the light goes RED when they are about 100 out. It’s a BUSY INTERSECTION. JOY thinks, then STEPS on gas, accelerating.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy, wait. Joy...Oh God. Lord Jesus. Bless this car. Bless this car! Ronnie closes her eyes as Joy BLOWS the LIGHT. Cars from other direction slam on their breaks, stopping just short them as they fly through the INTERSECTION. It’s as if in motion, the BRACE THEMSELVES, but they get through! Joy a Ronnie look at each other.  105.

dialogues.speaker: JOY/RONNIE
dialogues.text: Ahhh/Thank you God! Their faces turn to horror as they look forward. The truc has stopped dead ahead in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Stop!it!h!!

dialogues.speaker: SHIT/WATCH OUT
dialogues.text: Joy's SLAMS the brakes. Too late. She SLAMS into the back the TRUCK. Victor jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Whoa! Whoa, are you guys okay? What happened? Joy and Ronnie get out of the car. Victor recognizes them hurriedly clambers to get back in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?? Uh, where are you taking my stuff?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You have my molds in the back of truck. A POLICE CAR CHIRPS as it PULLS UP. A POLICEMAN gets out.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Officer, thank God! These men have stolen property in the back of that truck. My property.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Officer. I don’t know who these ladies are or what they want. I’m just making a delivery. I come at the corner, I slow down to turn and they bang into me. I don’t know what they’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What?! You know me. Officer, if you open up the back of this truck, you will find 6 steel manufacturing molds. I use them to make a mop and they stole them. of He  106.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: A mop?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yes, a mop.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: It’s a top seller at HSN.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: My wife watches that. (to Victor) Open up the truck.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Listen she’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yeah you wanna go to jail? Open up the truck. Victor signals to his partner, who opens up the truck. In the back are ALL OF JOY’S MOLDS. The cop looks at Joy.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do I know these are yours? Do you have any paperwork, any proof, anything that proves it?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t have a receipt but they send me shipments every month.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Listen, unless you can present me undeniable proof right now, I can’t give you this property.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: This is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (to the men) I need to see your manifest and your drivers license. (to Joy) And I need your drivers license as well.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? You’re gonna give me a ticket?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: You blew a red light. You’re lucky I don’t do worse.  107.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What about all my molds? My whole life’s in there.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: You'll need to take that up with an attorney. EXT. HIGHWAY. MOMENTS LATER. Joy and Ronnie stand there while the cop writes Joy a tic They watch as the truck PULLS AWAY with Joy’s stuff in it Joy is distraught. INT. LAWYERS’ OFFICE. Joy sits across from the lawyer, JOHN CALCAGNY.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: Pay the ticket. We have a bigger situation on our hands. I looked into Avalon Industries. I have a buddy on the west coast and...this is all confidential, but Avalon is under federal investigation.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: They are? What for?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: Racketeering, money laundering, violation of the interstate commerce Act. The whole thing is under a bigger investigation into-

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (nodding her head, she knew this) I knew it. So Evan Reynolds is a crook.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: Evan Reynolds doesn’t exist. Joy tilts her head.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay./Then who’s been cashing my checks?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: Avalon, anda couple other companies on the west coast, are shell corporations owned by Matty Aianello. You know, he’s--  108. Joy's looks like she seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Matty the Horse.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: They take the proceeds from bookmaking, loansharking, drugs, and launder it--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I know what they do.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: So, that being said, Avalon is not just the sole manufacturer on your mop. I just found out they own the patent for the mop.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We own the patent. We filed the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: No, you don’t. Who hooked you up with Avalon? INT. RUDY’S AUTOBODY SHOP. Rudy stands with some guys in the garage. Joy’s car pulls up. She gets out, slams the car door, and STORMS into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetheart. You alright?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I went to California. To Avalon. I know what’s going on. Rudy sobers up. The men get up and exit. Joy holds her st  109.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Why did you go out there? I told you we'd figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You gave my patent to the mob.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Wha-I,I--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: The business is gone. It’s gone now.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: You're delusional. Nothing’s gone. Why don’t you calm down. You don’t know anything about what you think you know.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I don’t know anything? I know you lied to me. I know you stole from me. You sold me out. You gave it all to the mob. Matty Aianello owns my business. What am I missing? Is there more? Beat. He starts to explain. Joy nods,

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I owed them money, okay? I thought I could hand the patent over, then buy it back once things got going. “Of course.”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: So you used me. You took everything I worked for and gave it away, like it was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know it was gonna turn into a big deal okay? It’s a mop. I didn’t think it was gonna go this far.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Great dad. Another vote of confidence.  110.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Hey. You needed help. I got you the molds. If it wasn’t for me you wouldn't have a business right now.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Without the patent, there IS no business.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: The patent is just a piece of paper, Joy. You don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Stop telling me I don’t understand! YOU don’t understand. You know so much about how business works? You're the big entrepreneur? Hows that worked out for you, dad? Your bus company went under. The weight loss program lasted four months. And the shop? I don’t even know how you stay afloat.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: Because of the relationships that I’ve spent 30 years building.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You're nowhere because of them!

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: You know not everyone gets lucky the first time out the gate. Not everybody gets the breaks you've had, Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with luck. I worked hard, dad. And I hoped this would work out. I hoped my dreams and your dreams would go together on this. But you’re only in it for yourself. My whole life you've been looking for the better situation. You did it to mom, you did it to us. And you're still doin’ it. You wanna be the big man. You want the big shot car the valet parks up front. You want to be one of them. But you know what? You're not one of them. You’re a stiff. You’re a mope. And you know what those mob guys think of you? They think your a sucker. A poor businessman always with his hand out.  111.

dialogues.speaker: RUDY
dialogues.text: What about you!!?? You’re so god- damn bull-headed, you don’t take the time to think anything through. I told you not to go out there!! But you, you gotta go out there. Cause you’re so much smarter than everybody else. You know it ALL. You did the same thing with Tony. No wonder he was looking for a way out! This hangs in the air. Joy is devastated. After a beat--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m your daughter. Rudy says nothing. Joy turns and walks away. INT. MAC DONALDS. The kids eat and Joy stares off into space. INT. TOOTS’S HOUSE. EVENING. Joy stands in front of Toots, who sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: I’ve got the shingles. Joy nods, “of course.”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (to the kids) Guys, go play. The kids run upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: I’ve been so worried about you and the kids, and how your father could do this, Joy. And anyway I just woke up today in so much pain, and I had these two bumps on my waist and so I took myself in cause I knew you were probably up to other things and anyway Dr. Mozingo says I’m under stress and I’ve got the shingles. It’s a virus, Joy. It’s just all so much--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.  112.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: You know, I hate to say it but I always knew this was gonna go down in flames.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks mom.

dialogues.speaker: TOOTS
dialogues.text: You take after me, and you’re father is gonna get the best of us every time. It’s big business, Joy. You're just a girl. We’re not made for it. INT. LIVING ROOM. CONTINUOUS. Joy and the kids enter. Bobby flips the tv on. Joy looks little off. She walks out of the room. INT. JOY’S BEDROOM. CONTINUOUS. Joy lays down on the bed in her clothes and conks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, the shades are drawn. There is no way to know time it is. Joy is asleep. She hears the door squeak open hears Jackie’s voice at the door. A beam of light hits Jo face.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jackie leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why is she sleeping again?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She’s tired. Leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (sadly) Mommy? The door CLOSES. The conversation has roused Joy. She sti then sits up. She looks around the room. It’s messy. INT. JOY'S HOUSE. STAIRWELL. CONTINUOUS. DAY. Joy comes down the stairs. As she walks, we see that some TIME HAS PASSED. The house is a mess.  113. There are little piles of clothes all over the place. Hal folded piles of laundry. Take-out food containers. An old dinner sits on the living room table. Tv is on downstairs She hears Christie in the kitchen arguing with Jackie and Bobby. She can’t make out what they’re saying. INT. KITCHEN. CONTINUOUS. Joy enters. The kids sit at the kitchen table in their designated spots, eating.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE
dialogues.text: Because I said so. I’m the oldest and I said so.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hi, mom.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hi. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Christie made dinner and we don’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE
dialogues.text: They won’t even try it. Everybody has to take three bites, that’s all I ask.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE
dialogues.text: Pickles on crackers. We’re out of bread so the crackers is the bread group. And the pickles are the vegetable group. It’s all on the table. And there are TOY TEA CUPS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I couldn’t reach the cups. (turns to kids, mom-like) Jackie that’s not a real bite. You know the rules. No dinner, no dessert. Joy looks at Jackie. Her hair is matted. Christie, stands with her APRON on, looking like a woman in charge. Bobby’ SHIRT is on INSIDE OUT with the TAG in the front. The kitchen, like the rest of the house, a mess. This picture snapshot from Joy’s childhood, is all too familiar. She takes it in. Just then, they hear the front door open.  114.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello! Tony enters. He takes in the scene. He can’t hide his sho

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow. Hey, guys.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Hey, dad.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Christie called me. Joy looks at Christie. Christie stares back at her, asham

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, mommy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: It’s ok.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know what guys? Why don’t you guys go play upstairs and I’1l talk to mommy for a minute and we’ll all go get some cheeseburgers. Daddy's gonna take you out to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Yay!! The kids run off. Tony sits across from Joy at the table.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) Looks like things are gettin’ a little crazy. I think we gotta figure something out here.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (breaks down) I don’t want to figure any more things out. I’m tired. I can’t do it anymore. Everything I care about, they rip it apart. That’s what they do. I just can’t fight against it anymore. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wish I could stop feeling this way but I’m done. I’m worn out.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Joy. You'll find a way to fix this.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No. There’s no way to fix this one. If I fulfill the order, I owe money and lose my company. If I don’t fulfill the order, I lose my company and my reputation, or I go up against the mob. And we all know how that ends. Beat. After a moment--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: You know that night? When you kicked me out--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Tony I don’t wanna--

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Just wait. That was enough for you. That was the end of it. You made the decision even though you had no back up. And then you went and did this great thing, which we both know never would have happened otherwise. Joy looks up at Tony.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You take your best shots when you're down. Of all of the options here, there’s only one that isn’t a guarantee of losing everything. And as far as the mob goes, they’re animals. But you’ve survived much worse than anything they could do.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Your folks. Joy cracks a smile “very funny.”

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m serious. You deal with Toots every day. She’s a hundred times worse than the mob. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy, you don’t see it, but everything you’ve already done is harder. You've taken care of everybody. These kids. These kids are great. You did that. You worked all these jobs and then you built this mop and you made something of yourself. (beat) You've never been a quitter. You’re gonna find a way. I know I wouldn’t try and get in your way. Between you and the mob, my money’s on you. Joy sits there.

dialogues.speaker: TONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take the kids for the night. You get some more rest. INT. JOHN CALCAGNY’S OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN CALCAGNY
dialogues.text: When is the deadline?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
